revised_title: Sturm-Liouville Series and Integral Equations in Function Representation
tldr: This article explores the representation of functions as a series of normal functions in the context of integral equations. It focuses on Sturm-Liouville series and their convergence properties, expanding on the work of Schmidt, Hilbert, and others. The author demonstrates the application of these series to a wide range of functions and discusses the potential for further development and extension to other expansions, such as Legendre's and Bessel's functions.
